atten2.ptxt: Replace any faulty parts of the seat belt systems (outer belt, inner belt, bolts, nuts, adjustable shoulder anchor, tether anchor hardware and other related parts). When inspecting a vehicle that was in a collision, be sure to check all of the seat belt systems regardless of whether or not the system was activated in the collision. Replace any damaged or malfunctioning systems.
Conduct this test in a safe area.

step2.ptxt: Drive the vehicle at 16 km/h (10 mph) and firmly depress the brakes. Check that the belts lock and cannot be extended at this time. If a belt does not lock, replace the seat belt assembly (See page ).

atten4.ptxt: Inspect a seat belt assembly before installing it (See page ).
